revised_title: A Study of Trypanosoma eberthi and Other Parasitic Forms in Fowl Intestines
tldr: The authors examine various parasitic forms found in the intestines of fowls, focusing on Trypanosoma eberthi. They describe the different conditions and bacterial flora in the caeca and rectum, and discuss the possible impact of these factors on the parasites. They also observe three main types of flagellate parasites (A, B, and C) and discuss their possible relationships and life cycles.
